description:
nova live-migration a7ff526d-0cab-4da7-92c2-49d8e89d1d27 dev02-compute-01 --block-migrate


gives this in nova log:
2016-11-01 21:48:49.242 14425 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [req-750740d4-c988-4d91-b690-78fca9ac20b4 08e955c2ffdb49b1abeb5b5c4f8fad03 805b50c70a744113b7d87dd248111275 - - -] [instance: a7ff526d-0cab-4da7-92c2-49d8e89d1d27] Live Migration failure: 'unicode' object has no attribute '_o'

and instance is not live-migrated.

regular migrating works:

title: Live Migration failure: 'unicode' object has no attribute '_o'

comments.content:
nova live-migration a7ff526d-0cab-4da7-92c2-49d8e89d1d27 dev02-compute-01 --block-migrate


gives this in nova log:
2016-11-01 21:48:49.242 14425 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [req-750740d4-c988-4d91-b690-78fca9ac20b4 08e955c2ffdb49b1abeb5b5c4f8fad03 805b50c70a744113b7d87dd248111275 - - -] [instance: a7ff526d-0cab-4da7-92c2-49d8e89d1d27] Live Migration failure: 'unicode' object has no attribute '_o'
2016-11-01 21:48:49.288 14425 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [req-750740d4-c988-4d91-b690-78fca9ac20b4 08e955c2ffdb49b1abeb5b5c4f8fad03 805b50c70a744113b7d87dd248111275 - - -] [instance: a7ff526d-0cab-4da7-92c2-49d8e89d1d27] Migration operation has aborted


and instance is not live-migrated.

regular migrating works:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~einar-nass-jensen

comments.content:
The vm's do not have a shared storage. 
passwordless ssh is set up for user nova on all compute nodes
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~einar-nass-jensen

comments.content:
Is there a stacktrace associated with this?

805b50c70a744113b7d87dd248111275 - - -] [instance: a7ff526d-0cab-4da7-92c2-49d8e89d1d27] Live Migration failure: 'unicode' object has no attribute '_o'

That would be needed to know where the actual failure is.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Crap, we don't actually stacktrace there...

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/mitaka/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L6111

Can you change that LOG.error to a LOG.exception and recreate and then post logs with the stacktrace?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
